Dear Mr. Laidacker:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Based on the findings of special investigation 2022C0128019 and special investigation
2022C0116025 it is recommended the license be modified to a first provisional license.
As indicated in the compliance conference on June 6, 2022, all reports will have this
recommendation until the issue is resolved.

Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Barbara Cote, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11

Traverse City, MI 49684

ALLEGATION:
On 5/24/22, youth engaged in an argument with staff at the facility due to staff
believing youth had a vape pen. Youth was restrained and forced onto their back
while the room was searched. Youth has marks, bruises, and scratches as a result.
No vape pen was located. Youth currently feels unsafe at facility.
INVESTIGATION:
3

Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported staff accused her of having a
vape, youth in the facility argued about vapes and which youth may or may not be in
possession of a vape. Youth A reported a youth ran from the facility, so some staff
were outside with that youth while the remaining youth started getting ready for bed.
Youth A was upstairs and asked staff if she could go downstairs to get water. Youth
A stated staff told her no and offered to get the water for her. Youth A reported she
did not want staff to get the water she wanted to go downstairs to get the water, so
Youth A headed toward the stairs. Youth A stated Staff 4 stepped in front of her and
Youth A punched her in the face. Supervisor 1, Staff 4 and Staff 3 placed her in a
restraint on the ground by the top of the stairs. Youth A denied remembering what
staff were holding what part of Youth A’s body during the restraint. Youth A stated
she was wiggling trying to get out of the restraint, staff released her so she ran down
the stairs and out of the facility. Youth A described once outside she walked through
the woods trying to get to Staff 6. Youth A stated she got to the front of the woods
by the road and a staff grabbed the back of Youth A’s shirt. Youth A described Staff
4 stopping her, Youth A punching Staff 4 a couple of times and then Supervisor 2
putting her in a hold. Youth A reported Supervisor 2 placed her in a restraint with
her hands behind her back while she yelled at him. Youth A stated after the restraint
she walked in the road and had a panic attack. Youth A said she could not breathe
so she laid in a ball in the road while Staff 6 and Supervisor 2 tried to help calm her.
Youth A reported someone “threw down the inhaler” then Youth A went back into the
facility.
Youth A stated she entered the facility and went upstairs into Youth G’s bedroom
and hit Youth G a couple of times because Youth G was picking on her and
laughing. Youth A reported Staff 5 and Staff 6 pulled Youth A and Youth G apart.
Youth A reported while upstairs she tried to exit through multiple windows. Youth A
described she got her foot out a window and Supervisor 2 pulled her back from the
window. Youth A stated she went back into her bedroom and tried to get out the
window but Staff 4 and Staff 5 blocked the window so she could not get out. Staff 4
and Staff 5 stood with their hands behind their backs but in front of the window.
Youth A stated she went into another bedroom and attempted to get out the window,
but a staff blocked the window. Youth A reported she ran downstairs and tried to get
out the backdoor, but Supervisor 1 blocked the door. Youth A stated the bruise on
her arm may be when staff grabbed her arm. Youth A reported the bruise on her
knee may be when she fell to the ground outside or when Supervisor 2 pulled her in
from the upstairs window. Youth A stated she was not sure if staff purposely put
bruises on her. Youth A reported she did not like being at the facility and was being
discharged in a week. Youth A stated the facility is “not stable for her mental health
and the girls are toxic.” Youth A could not provide specific examples.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 1 reported youth accused each
other of vaping. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was threatening to beat the “snitches
ass.” Supervisor 1 reported a youth ran out of the facility because of the situation.
4

Supervisor 1 stated all the youth were told to go to their bedrooms and start
transitioning into bedtime. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A asked to go downstairs to
get water and told staff she needed to get the water herself. Staff 4 blocked the
stairs and Youth A punched Staff 4. Supervisor 1 stated she placed Youth A in a
restraint with Staff 4 and Staff 3. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A was on her back
and tried to scoot to the steps. Supervisor 1 reported when Youth A got close to the
steps Supervisor 1 told Staff 3 and Staff 4 to let Youth A go because the restraint
was not in a safe area at the top of the stairs. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A ran
outside, through the bushes and assaulted Staff 4. Supervisor 1 stated while
outside Youth A had a panic attack, got her inhaler then came back into the facility
and assaulted Youth G. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A tried to get out of multiple
windows upstairs, came downstairs and attempted to escape the facility. Supervisor
1 stated Youth A finally sat down, and the police arrived. Supervisor 1 reported she
was not sure when or how Youth A got the bruises. Supervisor 1 denied Youth A
telling staff about the bruising. Supervisor 1 denied the restraints being excessive
and stated the staffs’ hands were in the “safe zone” on Youth A’s body.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 reported youth talked about vapes
being at the facility, so room searches took place. Supervisor 2 reported a youth left
the facility and he followed that youth. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A left the facility,
assaulted Staff 4 while outside, came back into the facility and assaulted Youth G
upstairs. Supervisor 2 described Youth A as being dysregulated, saying she was
going to harm herself and attempting to get out of the upstairs windows. Supervisor
stated Youth A put her leg out the window and Supervisor 2 pulled her in from the
window. Supervisor 2 reported he did not believe Youth A hit her leg on anything
when he pulled her in from the window. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A fell to the
ground in the street when she was outside saying she was having a panic attack.
Supervisor 2 reported he spoke with Youth A after the events and Youth A told him
she was “ok.” Supervisor 2 denied being aware of any bruises on Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she had been outside with the
youth that had left earlier so did not have much involvement with Youth A. Staff 1
described standing in front of the window in Youth A’s bedroom because Youth A
was going from room to room trying to get to the windows. Staff 1 denied seeing
any bruises on Youth A or hearing Youth A report that she was injured.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described Youth A as being a
“psychopath trying to jump out the windows to get attention.” Youth B stated she did
not recall all that was going on that night but knows Youth A was restrained for
punching Staff 4 in the face. Youth B stated she saw a bruise on Youth A’s leg prior
to the night Youth A was trying to jump out the windows.
5

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C stated Youth A’s “restraint was
needed” because Youth A hit staff and was trying to jump out windows. Youth C
reported staff were blocking the windows and exits. Youth C denied seeing any
bruises or marks on Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D reported Youth A wanted to get water
downstairs, staff offered to get the water and Youth A ran outside. Youth D reported
Youth A came back inside and attacked Youth G who was in her bedroom. Youth D
stated staff separated Youth A and Youth G. Youth D described Youth A trying to
get to the windows in the upstairs bedrooms and staff standing in front of the
windows. Youth D stated the police were called.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth E reported she barely remembers the
events but recalled Youth A entering Youth E’s bedroom and wanting to jump out the
window. Youth E stated she was in bed sleeping. Youth E denied seeing Youth A
be restrained, or any bruises on Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported staff had concerns youth at the
facility had vapes and were addressing the concerns with the youth. Staff 2 stated
the youth were accusing each other and getting upset. Staff 2 reported a youth left
the facility, so she followed the youth along with Staff 1. Staff 2 described Youth A
coming back in the house, running into Youth G’s bedroom, attacking Youth G then
Youth A running into bedrooms trying to jump out the windows. Staff 2 stated staff
were standing in front of the windows and blocking exits. Staff 2 denied seeing
Youth A be restrained. Staff 2 reported she did the medical check up with Youth A
and Youth A did not report anything hurting. Staff 2 stated the only mark/scratch
was on the back of Youth A’s neck and Staff 2 felt like that was from Youth G
grabbing Youth A’s hair.
Youth F was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth F described Youth A “coming out of
nowhere and hitting Youth G.” Youth F reported four staff came and separated
Youth A and Youth G. Youth F stated that was the only restraint she witnessed and
denied seeing any bruises on Youth A before or after the restraint. Youth F reported
Youth A was trying to jump out windows and staff were blocking the windows.
Medical was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Medical reported seeing Youth A the morning
following the incident. Medical stated Youth A had a bruise on her left knee, bruise
on her upper bicep and she reported her arms hurt. Medical reported Youth A told
her she was restrained and was in the road “flopping.”
6

Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described being upstairs with youth after the house
discussion about contraband. Staff 3 stated Youth A punched Staff 4 in the face and
was placed in a restraint by Staff 4 and Supervisor 1. Staff 3 reported she attempted
to move Youth A’s feet because Youth A was lying on her back near the top of the
steps. Staff 3 stated Youth A kept moving and got closer to the top of the stairs, so
Supervisor 1 said to let go of Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A got up and ran
outside after being let go. Staff 3 denied the restraint being excessive or not done
properly. Staff 3 denied Youth A showing her any bruises or reporting being hurt.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described Youth A asking to go downstairs to get water and
Supervisor 1 told Youth A that staff would get the water. Staff 4 stated Youth A told
Supervisor 1 she was going to get the water herself, so Staff 4 moved to block the
stairs. Staff 4 reported Youth A punched her in the face. Staff 4 placed Youth A in
an upper torso restraint with assistance from Supervisor 1. Staff 4 stated Youth A
fought the restraint and there was not much room in the hallway. Staff 4 reported
Youth A was placed on the floor on her back but kept wiggling her body towards the
steps. Staff 4 stated Supervisor 1 said let go so Staff 4, Supervisor 1 and Staff 3 let
go of Youth A. Staff 4 reported Youth A got up, ran down the stairs and outside.
Staff 4 reported Youth A fought the restraint and the location of where the restraint
took place was not ideal, but the restraint was done correctly.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 10, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 5 reported Youth A attacked Youth G after coming inside from
running out of the facility. Staff 5 reported Youth A tried to jump out the windows
upstairs two or three times and tried to barricade staff with a dresser that was in
Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 5 denied seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A or
hearing Youth A say anything was hurting.
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on June 13, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 6 reported she was not in the house when Youth A punched
Staff 4. Staff 6 stated she was upstairs when Youth A went into Youth G’s bedroom
and started punching Youth G. Staff 6 reported Youth A grabbed Youth G’s hair and
Youth G grabbed Youth A’s shirt. Staff 6 stated she got in-between Youth A and
Youth G and other staff came to assist. Staff 6 reported everyone involved was
moving all over the room because Youth A was pulling Youth G’s hair and would not
let go. Staff 6 stated when Youth A was outside, she was running through the
bushes and fell on the ground. Staff 6 reported Youth A never said where she got
the bruises. Staff 6 denied seeing any staff be excessive with Youth A or have any
concerns with how staff engaged with Youth A.
DHHS Worker has no findings in her investigation.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
7

Video footage of 05/24/2022 was reviewed at the facility with DHHS Worker on
05/26/2022. Video footage is consistent with staff interviews and incident report of
what took place inside the facility. Video does not show Youth A being restrained
while the room was searched. Video shows Youth A punch Staff 4 in the face and
then being restrained on her back. During the restraint Youth A is shown fighting the
restraint, trying to scoot closer to the top of the stairs and staff disengaging from the
restraint. Video shows Youth A enter another youth’s bedroom and start punching
and pulling that youth’s hair. Video shows staff enter the bedroom and separate the
two youth. Video shows Youth A having her left leg hang outside a bedroom window
and multiple attempts to get to other bedroom windows to escape from the facility.
Video shows Supervisor 2 move Youth A from the window when Youth A had her leg
out the window. Video shows staff members blocking window access from Youth A
in her other attempts to gain access to the windows. It is unclear what caused the
bruises and scratches on Youth A. The video shows the restraint technique was
proper and warranted.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Youth Opportunity Investments Initial Mental Health Crisis Assessment for
Youth A dated 05/25/2022 depicts Youth A being assessed by therapists and
being found not to need increased supervision.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report for Youth A dated 05/24/2022
describes restraint of Youth A for punching Staff 4 in the face when upstairs in
the facility. Incident report is consistent with what video shows.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report for Youth A dated 05/24/2022
describes restraint of Youth A for physically assaulting Youth G. Incident
report is consistent with what video shows.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report for Youth G dated 05/24/2022
describes restraint of Youth G. Incident report is consistent with what video
shows.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Physical Intervention Physical Assessment of
Youth A dated 05/24/2022 indicates, “youth said she feels fine, no injuries
recorded at this time.”
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services Incident Report
136750194 and 136780194. The reports are consistent with what video
shows inside the facility.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Medical Case Note dated 05/25/2022 reports,
“Physical assessment took place after Youth A reported flopping around in
the road with staff. Youth A did not offer any details about the incident.
Youth A had a small scrap on her right elbow and right wrist. Youth A
complained that her upper arms were sore, no further complaints were
mentioned.”
• Personnel Files for Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Staff 4, Staff 5 and Staff 6:
The only disciplinary record related to behavior management was for Staff 6.
Safe Crisis Management and de-escalation technique trainings were up to
date for these staff.
8

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance as staff interviews and video
demonstrate staff used appropriate technique of Safe Crisis
Management when restraining Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Youth A was restrained while outside the facility and the restraint was not
documented.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported leaving the facility and
running through the woods and making it to the front of the woods by the road.
Youth A described Staff 4 stopping her, Youth A punching Staff 4 a couple of times
and then Supervisor 2 putting her in a hold. Youth A reported Supervisor 2 placed
her in a restraint with her hands behind her back. Youth A stated after the restraint
she walked in the road and had a panic attack.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described Youth A running out of the facility, Staff 4 following
Youth A, catching up to Youth A and Youth A punching Staff 4 in the head and face.
Staff 4 stated Supervisor 2 assisted and placed Youth A in an upper torso restraint.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 10, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 5 described arriving at the facility to begin work and Staff 4
explaining Youth A was in the woods near the road. Staff 5 stated Youth A came out
of the woods very irritated and starting punching Staff 4 in the face. Staff 5 reported
she initiated an upper torso restraint and then Supervisor 2 came over and took over
the restraint.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on June 15, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 described Youth A running outside toward the
bushes and assaulting Staff 4. Supervisor 2 reported Youth A was not restrained.
9

Supervisor 2 stated, “a hold was attempted by myself, but Staff 4 stepped back so I
disengaged.”
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Reports for Youth A dated
05/24/2022 were not consistent with interviews. The incident report describes
Staff 5 assisting with Youth A by blocking Youth A's arm from hitting Staff 4
and Supervisor 2 assisting with the situation but does not indicate Youth A
was placed in an upper torso restraint.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services Incident Report
136750194. The report is not consistent with interviews. The incident report
describes Staff 5 assisting with Youth A by blocking Youth A's arm from
hitting Staff 4 and Supervisor 2 assisting with the situation but does not
indicate Youth A was placed in an upper torso restraint.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures regarding restraint. These policies and
procedures shall be available to all residents, their families,
and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as an incident report was
not completed when Supervisor 2 restrained Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Youth A’s inhaler was not stored in a separate, securely locked area that is
inaccessible to youth.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described having a panic attack while
she was outside. Youth A said she could not breathe so she laid in a ball in the road
while Staff 6 and Supervisor 2 tried to help calm her. She was outside and staff had
her put her hands above her head to help her breathe and she was given her
inhaler. Youth A reported someone “threw down the inhaler”. Then Youth A went
back into the facility.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described Youth A being outside, staff
following her and Youth A having a panic attack. Staff 2 stated, “kid kicked out
screen and threw down Youth A’s inhaler.” Youth A used her inhaler, came back
into the house, and attacked Youth G.
10

Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on June 9, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated Youth A ran out of the facility, was walking on the side
of the road and telling staff she could not breath. Staff 3 stated, “a youth threw
inhaler down to Youth A from upstairs.” Staff 3 reported Youth A used the inhaler
and went back into the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on June 10, 2022, in collaboration with
DHHS Worker and on July 5, 2022, without DHHS Worker. Staff 5 described
Staff 6 taking Youth A with her, and they walked toward the driveway. Staff 5 said
Youth A threw herself onto the road and was having an asthma attack. Staff 5
reported she grabbed the med keys and got Youth A’s inhaler from the med room in
the basement. Staff 5 stated while she was getting the inhaler one of the youths
upstairs got Youth A’s inhaler from Youth A’s backpack and threw it out the upstairs
bedroom window to staff. Staff 5 stated Youth A kept an inhaler in her backpack to
bring to school. Staff 5 stated after Youth A used her inhaler Youth A walked back
into the house, went upstairs, and got into a physical altercation with another youth.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• New Hope Youth Center Pharmaceuticals Policy, IV. Procedures: A. Storage
1. Outlines: “All medications (prescription, over-the-counter, topical, etc.) shall
be stored in a separate, securely locked area that is inaccessible to youth.”
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents' needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as one of Youth A’s
inhalers was not stored in a separate, securely locked area that
is inaccessible to youth.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
On June 6, 2022, Staff 7 had her child at work with her at the facility.
INVESTIGATION:
I was at the facility on June 6, 2022, interviewing youth and staff in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. I walked into the living room and observed a
11

child that I did not recognize. I asked Youth F who the child in the living room was.
Youth F stated the child was Staff 7’s daughter.
Following Youth F’s interview, I asked Staff 7 if she was at the facility for her shift.
Staff 7 reported she was on shift.
I proceeded to the basement to speak to Supervisor 1 and inquired how many times
Staff 7 has brought her child to work. Supervisor 1 stated she believed this was the
second time.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4130 Privacy and confidentiality.
(1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy
and confidentiality and shall protect residents from
exploitation.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as the agency did not
assure youth privacy and confidentiality by allowing Staff 7’s
child to be present at the organization, interacting with the
residents.
Technical Assistance
The agency was informed this situation not only failed to protect
the privacy and confidentiality of the youth but could also posse
safety and supervision issues.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Youth A reported if youth do not eat the food provided youth are not given an
alternative meal choice.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported if youth do not eat the food
provided, youth are not given an alternative meal choice. Youth A described salmon
being served for dinner and many youths not wanting to eat the salmon. Youth A
stated Supervisor 2 would not allow the youth to get anything else to eat so many
youths did not eat that night.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 1 reported the youth pick the meal
menu during townhall meetings. Supervisor 1 reported youth are always given an
alternative meal if they do not like what is being offered. Supervisor 1 denied being
aware of youth not eating because an alternative meal was withheld.
12

Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 26, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 denied withholding any alternative
meals from the youth the night salmon was served or any other time. Supervisor 2
stated youth have full input on the menus. Supervisor 2 stated youth are
encouraged to eat what is being served but are always provided an alternative meal.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B stated youth are always given an
alternative meal if they do not like what is being offered. Youth B reported the
alternative meal is a sandwich or salad. Youth B stated a lot of youth did not eat the
salmon that night for dinner but were offered an alternative meal.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C stated there is always alternative food
to eat if a youth do not like a meal. Youth C reported the alternative meal is soup,
sandwich, or salad.
